intro: Prosaptia preslii, commonly known as the Malabar thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental species. The plant is characterized by its woody stem, opposite leaves, and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range from white to pink. It produces small, berry-like fruits that are yellow when mature. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and studied for its chemical properties.
